name: TheAtlantic
text: "When uncertainty rages, human nature will lead many people to seek a more stable reality by wrapping themselves in an ever-tighter cloak of political, religious, or racial identities," @intelwire writes: https://t.co/QcAbVZm8U8

name: TheAtlantic
text: "For all their grandeur, written constitutions do not produce better democratic outcomes or help solve sophisticated societal problems," @bchristophjones writes: https://t.co/hwD9yOGJNs

name: TheAtlantic
text: He boiled strings, cut vibrato bars in half, put the head of one guitar on the body of another—and created a sound that changed rock forever. James Parker remembers Eddie Van Halen: https://t.co/Oq2Y0BurGr

name: TheAtlantic
text: The news cycle churns apace. Stay informed, but remember to take breaks. Here's a non-newsy reading list from our editors, in the latest Atlantic Daily by @mimbsy: https://t.co/Anp1Z6XW0L

name: TheAtlantic
text: The poet Louise Glück, who won the Nobel Prize in Literature this week, examines our compulsion to tell the same stories again and again. In the face of destruction, she asks, how can belief in new beginnings possibly still exist? Walt Hunter writes: https://t.co/UQzPvOqQ0N

name: TheAtlantic
text: Jefferson preferred Jesus’s teachings to his supernatural acts—and edited his copy of the New Testament accordingly, James Parker writes. https://t.co/v0OCUUaSrD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Seven months into the pandemic, courts around the country are beginning to restart their criminal dockets. As they dip their toes into these waters, the practical obstacles are staggering," @JessicaARoth1 writes: https://t.co/eTtL2hAO8t

name: TheAtlantic
text: Lots of people have visited St. Matthew Island over the past 400 years. But no one has stayed for long, writes Sarah Gilman. https://t.co/tuF3Aq5xgn

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "Trump has made the most impact with what he hasn’t done—firmly uphold the U.S.-led global order." https://t.co/ZO8xxXUotm

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @anneapplebaum: If we quit the WHO, it won't disappear. Instead, China's influence within the organization - and everywhere else - will continue to expand. 

https://t.co/tVwVLfQBU9

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: “I don’t see that the opportunity for the discussions, the engagement, between the two sides will come in the near future," Taiwanese Foreign Minister Joseph Wu told @MichaelSchuman of talks with China. Read his latest in @TheAtlantic https://t.co/ZO8xxXCN4M
